_header: The lord that is a householder
_description: Exposition of the Eight Feasts of the Church — 335 lines in stanzas of varying length

BLRoy18Ax.First Lines:
The lord þat is a hows holder with faire festis folk he
                    fatȜiueþ hem wedys hym self doþe wer on bolstre bed her
                    balys bat…
BLRoy18Ax.Last Lines:
…In þis ensaumple Iohan say eslye as he slombrid in
                    slepyngeIn goddis godhed he say full hyȝe þe heyȝtes of hys
                    hyȝe kynge[Withoute any…]
BLRoy18Ax.Note:
Ends imperfectly. Catchwords ‘Withoute any’ at the foot of
                    f. 134v.
BLRoy18Ax.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Legends of the Holy Rood, Symbols of the Passion, and
                Cross-Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 46 (1871); repr. 1973: 210-21.
